instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't detect SSD with replacement battery
threads.message:
So last week I got in an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board just for a straight battery swap, took the old battery out as usual no issues, connected new battery up powered on and I get the flashing folder with ? symbol. Replugged the SSD - same behaviour - unplugged battery and tried without battery - boots up normal SSD is detected. 

Plugged the old battery back in and works normally, i've then ordered another battery from a different supplier which I received today popped that one in and again we have the flashing folder with a ? symbol.

Has Apple now done something to disable battery swaps is what i'm now wondering? Or I just happen to have two faulty batteries from different suppliers?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't detect SSD with replacement battery
threads.message:
Does this happen w/ and w/o charger connected?
I think someone reported such issue with battery alone; when charge level goes low.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't detect SSD with replacement battery
threads.message:
Yes behaviour is the same with and without the charger connected. Battery as fitted has around 75% charge so is nowhere near a low level!

I found a workaround where if I start the machine up with the charger only connected and then connect the battery up it continues to work and behave normally.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't detect SSD with replacement battery
threads.message: You should test and find another battery for this machine.
